ai-ud7.3:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud7.3:1.3_0: Now at that time most of the people in Sāvatthī overly clung to sensual pleasures. Lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, they lived completely addicted to sensual pleasures.
ai-ud7.3:2.1_0: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ai-ud7.3:2.2_0: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha,
ai-ud7.3:2.2_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud7.3:2.4_0: “Here, sir, most of the people in Sāvatthī overly clung to sensual pleasures.”
ai-ud7.3:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud7.3:4.1_0: “Clinging to sense pleasures, clinging to the shackle of sense pleasures,
ai-ud7.3:4.2_0: blind to the faults of the fetters;
ai-ud7.3:4.3_0: for sure, clinging to the fetters’ chains
ai-ud7.3:4.4_0: Cannot cross over the wide and great flood.”
